intro: Prasophyllum aureoviride var. elmae, commonly known as the Elmae Leek Orchid, is a rare and striking orchid species native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland or open forest habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its botanical features include narrow, grass-like leaves and a distinctive, leek-shaped inflorescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
